summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from late June to early July 2020 concerning the planning and approval for travel and expenses related to the arrest of a target (Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss shifting the operation from Massachusetts to New Hampshire, the need for technical assets to locate Maxwell's phone, and the final approval to execute a search warrant.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: The primary FBI agent coordinating the travel approval and operational updates for the arrest operation targeting Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the target of the arrest operation in the Epstein investigation, with her phone location being tracked to New Hampshire.

connections.description: The FBI agent is coordinating the operational planning and approval for the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Initial travel request for arrest operation
events.description: An FBI agent requests travel approval to arrest a target (Ghislaine Maxwell) believed to be in Massachusetts, planning for a team of four to drive up and possibly escort the target back to NY.

events.title: Shift in target location to New Hampshire
events.description: The operation shifts focus as historical phone data indicates the target (Maxwell) is in New Hampshire, requiring a change in plans and potential deployment of technical assets from Boston and Newark.

events.title: Approval to execute search warrant
events.description: The FBI team is waiting for a search warrant to be signed before executing the operation to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: In late June 2020, the FBI was planning an operation to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell, initially believing she was in Massachusetts.
Historical phone data indicated Maxwell's location had shifted to New Hampshire, requiring the FBI to adjust their operational plans.
The FBI requested approval for travel expenses and considered moving technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone.
By July 2, 2020, the FBI was awaiting the signing of a search warrant before executing the arrest operation.
The emails reveal coordinated internal FBI planning for Maxwell's arrest, involving cost estimates and logistical coordination for a multi-agent team.
